title: Boro language (India)
summary: Boro[2] (बर'/बड़ [bɔɽo]), also Bodo,[3] is a Sino-Tibetan language spoken primarily by the Boro people of Northeast India, Nepal and Bengal. It is official language of the Bodoland autonomous region and co-official language of the state of Assam in India.[4] It is also one of twenty two languages listed in the Eighth Schedule of the Constitution of India.[5] Since 1975 the language has been written using the Devanagari script. It was formerly written using Latin and Bengali-Assamese scripts. Some scholars have suggested that the language used to have its own now lost script known as Deodhai.
